metadata.Title: CVE-2017-8067 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium
metadata.Description:
drivers/char/virtio_console.c in the Linux kernel 4.9.x and 4.10.x before4.10.12 interacts incorrectly with the CONFIG_VMAP_STACK option, whichallows local users to cause a denial of service (system crash or memorycorruption) or possibly have unspecified other impact by leveraging use ofmore than one virtual page for a DMA scatterlist.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-8067` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1114-azure - 4.11.0-1009.9
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1099-gcp - 4.10.0-1004.4
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux-goldfish: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-mako: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-flo: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-azure package in esm-infra/xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.11.0-1009.9').
